name: Satellite Crimebusters
body:
### Sea vessel tracking using Satellite AIS data

The Satellite Crimebusters team, at the June 2014 Inventorthon, analysed [AIS data](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automatic_Identification_System) obtained via [satellite](http://www.exactearth.com/technology/satellite-ais/).
The event was hosted by the [Satellite Applications Catapult](https://sa.catapult.org.uk/) in Harwell.

### Data analysis

Where are vesselslaiming to be when they transmit?  The following are the contours of vessel locations:

![Contours of transmission locations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Derek-Jones/Sat-Crimebusters/master/images/vessel-density-22.png)
How many transmissions do vessels make per day?  The following shows the number of vessels making a given number of transmissions each day (over one month).  Many vessels make many transmissions per day, while many make very few, with the remaining being somewhere inbetween.

![Transmissions per day over a month](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Derek-Jones/Sat-Crimebusters/master/images/trans-per-mmsi.png)
